variant.question: According to the applicable operational requirements, the Operator shall establish and maintain a Flight Data Monitoring programme, and appoint a post-holder responsible for the programme. The responsible for the programme is:

options.text: Safety Manager.
Quality Manager.
Accountable Manager.
Compliance Monitoring Manager.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 6, a flight data analysis programme shall contain adequate safeguards to protect the (1) \_\_\_\_\_ in accordance with (2) \_\_\_\_\_.

options.text: (1) completeness of the data; (2) ICAO Annex 17
(1) completeness of the data; (2) ICAO Annex 19
(1) source(s) of data; (2) ICAO Annex 17
(1) source(s) of data; (2) ICAO Annex 19

variant.question: ICAO Annex 6 describes the content associated with the completion of a maintenance release. The purpose of the maintenance release for an aircraft is:

options.text: It is a document that is used by the pilots to prepare an aircraft prior to conducting a flight test following a maintenance procedure.
To confirm that any maintenance work conducted on an aircraft has been completed satisfactorily in accordance with approved data and procedures.
The maintenance release procedure confirms that the aircraft is prepared and safe for maintenance to be conducted on the airframe and / or on-board systems.
It is a document confirming that the daily check has been completed by a qualified engineer, that the aircraft is free from technical faults, and is released for service.

variant.question: The coverage angle of the regulatory white navigation/position light located at the rear of the aircraft is
ICAO Annex 6 (Part I and Part III) requires Commercial Air Transport Operators of aeroplanes and/or helicopters to establish a flight safety documents system. The purpose of this system is:

options.text: To distribute safety and operational information to all operational personnel, with a means to check that all relevant personnel have read the information.
To provide a set of standardised forms for pilots when reporting safety-related events and sending information to the Operator about any issue with the Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
To distribute safety-critical information to pilots prior to flight, as part of the preflight briefing package prepared by the Operations or Flight Planning department.

To allow the flight crew to read the latest safety-related amendments to the Operations Manual from either the Operator or the Authority, before these have been formally incorporated into the Operations Manual.

variant.question: According to ICAO Annex 6 Part I, a Commercial Air Transport Operator of aeroplanes is required to establish a flight data analysis programme as part of the Safety Management System when operating:

options.text: One or more aeroplanes with a Maximum Certificated Take-Off Mass in excess of 27 000 kg.
One or more aeroplanes with a Maximum Certificated Take-Off Mass in excess of 5 700 kg.
At least two aeroplanes equipped with flight data recorders and cockpit voice recorders.
One or more aeroplanes equipped with flight data recorders and cockpit voice recorders.

variant.question: Who is responsible for the Flight Data Monitoring (FDM) programme?

options.text: Quality manager.
Safety review board.
Accountable manager.
Safety manager.

variant.question: An aircraft is performing an ILS CAT II approach and it is not equipped with a HUD. At DH the pilot can see 5 consecutive approach lights only. What's the correct procedure?

options.text: The pilot can continue below DH and land.
The pilot must go around immediately.
The pilot can continue below DH down to 80 ft and land if they see the threshold.
The pilot can continue below DH down to 80 ft and land if they can see the edge lights.
